Get Statics
Upload
Searching
Create User Ratings
resources.description:
to create user rating send the follwing to this endpoint 

	{
    "content": "you are greet", // the content of the rating
    "rating": 5, // the rating as an int from 1 to 5
    "meca": 2, // meca's id
    "client": 14 // client's id
	}

response 

	{
	"id": 1,
	"content": "you are greet",
	"rating": 5,
	"created_at": "2024-03-09T08:04:33.301114Z",
	"meca": 2,
	"client": 14
	}

resources.name: Uploading/Retrieving image
Reset Password

Getting Pages or FAQs
resources.description:
this endpoint retrieves the Pages and the FAQs that the admin added
to retrieve a page send the `type` param as a JSON palyoad, the param acceps two Values
PA : for retrieving Pages.
FA : for FAQs
Body Ex:: { "type" : 'PA' } Response EX : [ { "id": 12, "title": "Notification 1", "content": "

this is page 1

", "url": "https://dashboard.mecatech-dz.com/page/12/" } ] Important : the values are case sensative, so be carefull when assigning them

resources.name: Get Social Media Links
Getting the firebase APIKEY
Creating a category
resources.description: to create a new category send the body data - as shown on the body - to this ednpoint

resources.name: Getting Categories
resources.description: you can send the ```category_type``` as a body param where: Ps: ("1","Vendeur"), ("2","Service") Ex : { "category_type" : 2 } the returned response will be the category type you specified, Ex : [ { "id": 3, "category_name": "kia", "category_image": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/media/category/thumbnails/vecteezy_isometric-style-illustration-about-a-web-programmer-working_6552084.jpg", "category_type": "2", "is_activated": true }, { "id": 4, "category_name": "BMW", "category_image": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/media/category/thumbnails/vecteezy_isometric-style-illustration-about-a-web-programmer-working_tnd9yD8.jpg", "category_type": "2", "is_activated": true } ] Note that when you dont specify a type a queryset containing all categories created by admin will be returned

resources.name: updating a schedule
resources.description:
this ednpoint updates the schedule's state for both meca and client. it allows you to update the schedule to be canceled/activated and approved/disapproved .
you can send a PUT request to this endpoint {{ _.BASE_URL }}schedules// where is the id that you want to update the JSON body could be sent as following : { "value" : true , "role" : "meca" } where: value : is a bool that represents the new states (approved/disapproved , activeted/canceled) role : is the type of the account that's sending the request the `role` param accepts two values as the following: `meca` : when specifying the ` "role" : "meca" ` it sets the schedule to be approved/disapproved : when specifying the ` "role" : "client" ` it sets the schedules to be (activated/disactivated) the expected response should be : { "success": "3 has been updated successfully" }

resources.name: Creating a new schedule
resources.description:
to create a new schedules you have to send the following data to this endpoint 

	{
    "schedule": <datetime> , // the date and time of the request
    "is_approved": <bool>, // whether the schedule is acpected or not
		"is_active" : <bool> . // whether the schedule is activated or not
    "meca": <meca_id>, // the meca's id
    "client": <client_id> // the client'S Id
	}

Response Ex :

	{
	"id": 1,
	"schedule": "2024-03-10T08:00:00Z",
	"is_approved": false,
	"created_at": "2024-03-05T10:03:24.552439Z",
	"meca": 14,
	"client": 2
	}

resources.name: Getting Schedules
resources.description:
by sending a GET request to this endpoint you get all the user's schedules 

Body ex:

	{
		"user_id" : 2
	}
Response Ex:

	[
		{
			"id": 3,
			"schedule": "2024-03-10T08:00:00Z",
			"is_active": false,
			"is_approved": true,
			"created_at": "2024-03-05T10:07:53.742895Z",
			"meca": 14,
			"client": 2
		},
		{
			"id": 2,
			"schedule": "2024-03-10T08:00:00Z",
			"is_active": false,
			"is_approved": false,
			"created_at": "2024-03-05T10:07:15.716513Z",
			"meca": 14,
			"client": 2
		},
		{
			"id": 1,
			"schedule": "2024-03-10T08:00:00Z",
			"is_active": false,
			"is_approved": false,
			"created_at": "2024-03-05T10:03:24.552439Z",
			"meca": 14,
			"client": 2
		}
	]

resources.name: Creating feedback
resources.description:
Creating a feedback could be achieved by sending a post request via this endpoint , ex :

	{
			"rating": 3, // a rating vaue from 1 to 5
			"content": "this is great", // the rating comment
			"meca": 2, // the meca user that will be rated
			"client": 14 // the user that put this rating 
	}

expected response :

	{
		"id": 1,
		"rating": 3,
		"content": "this is great",
		"created_at": "2024-03-07T08:35:10.123048Z",
		"meca": 2,
		"client": 14
	}

resources.name: Getting Feedbacks
Creating a new Notification
resources.description:
Create a notification for a user. response ex: { "id": 23281, "title": "New Message", "message": "You have a new message from John Doe.", "timestamp": "2024-03-26T11:03:58.926573Z", "image": null, "tag": null, "user": 14 } Notes :
1 - title (optional): The title of the notification.
2 - user: The ID of the user receiving the notification.
3 - message: The content of the notification message.
4 - image (optional): An optional image attached to the notification (if provided in the request).

resources.name: Getting User Notifivation
resources.description: in order to get the user's notification list you need to pass the user's ID to the ENDPOINT

resources.name: Sending a message
resources.description:
sending a message :
Body ex:

	{
			"message": "hello ?",
			"conversation": 1,
			"user": 14, // the sender's ID
			"receiver": 2
	}

Response Ex:

	{
		"id": 1,
		"message": "hello ?",
		"timestamp": "2024-03-17T08:02:20.075840Z",
		"conversation": 1,
		"user": 14,
		"receiver": 2
	}

resources.name: Creating a user Conversations
Getting Conversations List
Deleting User
resources.description:
to delete user send the deleter request as followng 

	{{ _.BASE_URL }}user_id/<user_id>/	

Ex :
	
	{{ _.BASE_URL }}user_id/2/

resources.name: Updating User Data
resources.description:
Update a user's email, password, username, and phone number.
by sending a PUT request to this endpoint :	
	
	{{ _.BASE_URL }}user_id/<user_id>/

with the following data :

	{

			"email": "newemail_2@example.com",
			"password": "newpassword_2",
			"username": "newusername_2",
			"phone_number": "1234567890",
			"first_name" :	"mr none",
			"last_name" : "mr none"
	}

response :
	
	{
		"success": "User has been updated successfully"
	}

resources.name: Getting User Data using AUTH token
resources.description: this ENDPOINT allows you to get the user DATA using the user_id only sending the next body { "user_id" : } will result the following Response { "id": 2, "first_name": "amraoui", "last_name": "random", "username": "random", "email": "amrmoh023@gmail.com" } Note : this ENDPOINT requires the AUTH token

resources.name: Getting User Data without an auth
resources.description:
To Get a specific user's data such as ID , E-mail , Username etc..
you have to send the user's CREDS to as a body, Exactly as specified on this Example.
ex: { "username_or_email": "amraouimohamedtaher@gmail.com", "password" : "1234" } After that a JSON response is returned containes the required User's Data. ex:
{ "id": 20, "first_name": "mr", "last_name": "smith", "username": "mr_smith_00", "email": "mrsmith00000@gmail.com" } Note : this ENDPOINT doesn't require an AUTH token

resources.name: Creating a new user
Update a profile
resources.description:
to update a profile send the profile id along with a PUT request to the url:

	{{ _.BASE_URL }}userProfile/<profile_id>/

then on your body send the fileds that you want to update ex:

	{
		"role" : "user",
		"gender": "fm"

	}

response Ex:

	{
	"id": 14,
	"user": 31,
	"user_image": null,
	"birth_date": null,
	"user_fcm": "",
	"gender": "fm",
	"phone_number": "1234567890",
	"role": "user",
	"wilaya": "1",
	"latitude": 3.141414,
	"longitude": 23.875755,
	"description": "non persona",
	"is_approved": true,
	"agency": null,
	"service_type": []
	}

resources.name: Profiles
resources.description: All fields on this endpoint are optional so the developer can control all of them as he likes

resources.name: creating a new user profile
resources.description:
Accepted attributes:

user_fcm : a key that repesents the device's ID
gender : "ml", "fm"
role : "meca" => Mécanicien && "user" => Utilisateur
wilaya : an integer that correspend to the selected wilaya: WILAYA_CHOICES = ( ('1', 'Adrar'), ('2', 'Chlef'), ('3', 'Laghouat'), ('4', 'Oum El Bouaghi'), ('5', 'Batna'), ('6', 'Béjaïa'), ('7', 'Biskra'), ('8', 'Bechar'), ('9', 'Blida'), ('10', 'Bouira'), ('11', 'Tamanrasset'), ('12', 'Tbessa'), ('13', 'Tlemcen'), ('14', 'Tiaret'), ('15', 'Tizi Ouzou'), ('16', 'Alger'), ('17', 'Djelfa'), ('18', 'Jijel'), ('19', 'Setif'), ('20', 'Saefda'), ('21', 'Skikda'), ('22', 'Sidi Bel Abbes'), ('23', 'Annaba'), ('24', 'Guelma'), ('25', 'Constantine'), ('26', 'Medea'), ('27', 'Mostaganem'), ('28', 'M\'Sila'), ('29', 'Mascara'), ('30', 'Ouargla'), ('31', 'Oran'), ('32', 'El Bayadh'), ('33', 'Illizi'), ('34', 'Bordj Bou Arreridj'), ('35', 'Boumerdes'), ('36', 'El Tarf'), ('37', 'Tindouf'), ('38', 'Tissemsilt'), ('39', 'El Oued'), ('40', 'Khenchela'), ('41', 'Souk Ahras'), ('42', 'Tipaza'), ('43', 'Mila'), ('44', 'Ain Defla'), ('45', 'Naama'), ('46', 'Ain Temouchent'), ('47', 'Ghardaefa'), ('48', 'Relizane'), ('49', 'El M\'ghair'), ('50', 'El Menia'), ('51', 'Ouled Djellal'), ('52', 'Bordj Baji Mokhtar'), ('53', 'Béni Abbès'), ('54', 'Timimoun'), ('55', 'Touggourt'), ('56', 'Djanet'), ('57', 'In Salah'), ('58', 'In Guezzam'), ) latitude && latitude : will be retrieven by a script, JavaScript ex: function getGeolocation() { if (navigator.geolocation) { navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(showPosition); } else { console.log("Geolocation is not supported by this browser."); } } user : User's id
type : accepts the following : ('vendeur','vendeur'), ('service' , 'service') service_type : service type accepts string of objects Note : You have to pay a strict attention when creating users , cause the data of each user's defferent based on the user'S role Body Ex: { "user_image": null, "birth_date": null, "user_fcm": "dAqnDI3mSSGqUw6l1_sMKX:APA91bEoTwYf5JTstGHKKt1fW_IXkZp7RZuZg-p0YM_C0IDTF6gHSg4m_NLcbtuI0qI2pxOWKx7YaTll4udhXzbgHMZKMzl5e7azJhdCrna_-IJBn9phz0WBgh0ZvYygkzUHDf7St1VD", "gender": "ml", "phone_number": "1234567890", "role": "user", "wilaya": "1", "latitude": 3.141414, "longitude": 23.875755, "description": "non persona", "is_approved": true, "delivery": null, "type" : null, "user": 42, "agency": [], "service_type": [] } Response ex: { "id": 24, "user_fcm": "dAqnDI3mSSGqUw6l1_sMKX:APA91bEoTwYf5JTstGHKKt1fW_IXkZp7RZuZg-p0YM_C0IDTF6gHSg4m_NLcbtuI0qI2pxOWKx7YaTll4udhXzbgHMZKMzl5e7azJhdCrna_-IJBn9phz0WBgh0ZvYygkzUHDf7St1VD", "user_image": null, "birth_date": null, "gender": "ml", "phone_number": "1234567890", "role": "user", "wilaya": "1", "latitude": 3.141414, "longitude": 23.875755, "description": "non persona", "is_approved": true, "delivery": null, "type": null, "user": 42, "agency": [], "service_type": [] }

body.text:
{
    "user_image": null,
    "birth_date": null,
	  "user_fcm": "dAqnDI3mSSGqUw6l1_sMKX:APA91bEoTwYf5JTstGHKKt1fW_IXkZp7RZuZg-p0YM_C0IDTF6gHSg4m_NLcbtuI0qI2pxOWKx7YaTll4udhXzbgHMZKMzl5e7azJhdCrna_-IJBn9phz0WBgh0ZvYygkzUHDf7St1VD",
    "gender": "ml",
    "phone_number": "1234567890",
    "role": "user",
    "wilaya": "1",
    "latitude": 3.141414,
    "longitude": 23.875755,
    "description": "non persona",
    "is_approved": true,
    "delivery": null,
		"type" : null,
    "user": 50,
    "agency": [],
    "service_type": []
}

resources.name: Get a list of profiles
resources.description:
send a get request as following 

	{
	 		"user_id" : <integer> // integer representing the user's id
	}

to get the folowing  which represents the response :


	{
		"profile": {
			"id": 26,
			"user_fcm": "dAqnDI3mSSGqUw6l1_sMKX:APA91bEoTwYf5JTstGHKKt1fW_IXkZp7RZuZg-p0YM_C0IDTF6gHSg4m_NLcbtuI0qI2pxOWKx7YaTll4udhXzbgHMZKMzl5e7azJhdCrna_-IJBn9phz0WBgh0ZvYygkzUHDf7St1VD",
			"user_image": null,
			"birth_date": null,
			"gender": "ml",
			"phone_number": "1234567890",
			"role": "user",
			"wilaya": "1",
			"latitude": 3.141414,
			"longitude": 23.875755,
			"description": "non persona",
			"is_approved": true,
			"delivery": null,
			"type": null,
			"user": 50,
			"agency": [],
			"service_type": []
		},
		"email_confirmation": false
	}

resources.name: Deleting Props
Updating input's data
resources.description:
this endpoint updates the user car object'S propreties. by sending a put request to : {{ _.BASE_URL }}user_car_extra// where : is the object's ID that user wants to update if the object's input type is 'entretien' the distance JSON param is required ex : { "distance": 2311 } and for 'paiers' type : { "date_start": , "date_end": } Notes
1 - Provide the date_start and date_end fields in the request body to update the user car extra information for the 'papiers' type.
2 - Provide the distance field in the request body to update the user car extra information for the 'entretien' type.

resources.name: Assigning a new field to user's car
resources.description: to assign some values to the input that admin has added all you have to do is to send a POST request to this endpoint as follwiing . { "distance": "50", // null value can be assigned depending on the input's type using an integer "date_start": null, // null value can be assigned depending on the input's type using a date "date_end": null, // null value can be assigned depending on the input's type using a date "user_car": 2, // the car's ID that's related to those inputs "input": 3 // the input's ID } Response ex: { "id": 4, "input_name": "field 3", "input_type": "papiers", "input_id": "6", "distance": null, "date_start": null, "date_end": null, "user_car": 2, "input": 6 } Note : 1 - all fields are optional so you can customize them as you need. 2 - when filling fields you have to fill them according to the type

resources.name: the car's extra fields
resources.description:
getting the extra fields of a specific car requires you to send the car's id as the following :

	{
		"car_id" : 1
	}

then a list of dicts returns the already existing a fields of the car you specified
	
	[
	{
		"id": 1,
		"input_name": "srial",
		"input_type": "entretien",
		"input_id": "3",
		"distance": 50000,
		"date_start": null,
		"date_end": null,
		"user_car": 2,
		"input": 3
	},
	{
		"id": 2,
		"input_name": "srial",
		"input_type": "entretien",
		"input_id": "3",
		"distance": null,
		"date_start": null,
		"date_end": null,
		"user_car": 2,
		"input": 3
	},
	{
		"id": 3,
		"input_name": "srial",
		"input_type": "entretien",
		"input_id": "3",
		"distance": 50,
		"date_start": null,
		"date_end": null,
		"user_car": 2,
		"input": 3
	},
	{
		"id": 4,
		"input_name": "field 3",
		"input_type": "papiers",
		"input_id": "6",
		"distance": null,
		"date_start": null,
		"date_end": null,
		"user_car": 2,
		"input": 6
	}
	]
	
if no car_id is specified a response will be returned as follwoing

	{
		"error": "please specify a car_id"
	}

resources.name: Creating a new User Car
resources.description:
Creating a car for a specific user can be achieved via sending a POST request to this endpoint with the following explained on the body, where :

	{
			"car_name": "", // the name of the car
			"car_description": "a black kia", // its description
			"user": 2, // the user ID 
			"car_brand": 1 // an integer represents the agency's ID 
	}
	
the response should be a dicts showing the car'S data. ex:

	{
	"id": 2,
	"car_name": "kia 200e",
	"car_description": "a black kia",
	"timestamp": "2024-02-12T12:19:57.219254Z",
	"user": 1,
	"car_brand": 1
	}

resources.name: List Of Users Cars
Get Sub Agency Using ID

Creating a new Agency
resources.description: To create a new agency , send the data as a body to this endpoint

resources.name: Get Agencies List
resources.description: This ENDPOINT gets you all the agencies added by the admin , all you have to do is to get'em using a a simple GET request without any additional steps, the response should be something as : [ { "id": 1, "agency_image": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/media/images/agence/Developper_01__Converted__generated_rw6bPw7.jpg", "agency_name": "Kia2", "phone_number": "1234567890", "latitude": 23.3232, "longitude": 2123.0, "is_activated": true } ] Note : when specifying `agency_id` on the json the response will containe only the agency with the specified id . Request Body : { "agency_id" : 1 } Response : { "id": 1, "agency_image": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/media/images/agence/Developper_01__Converted__generated_rw6bPw7.jpg", "agency_name": "Kia2", "phone_number": "1234567890", "latitude": 23.3232, "longitude": 2123.0, "is_activated": true }

resources.description: Dealing with user's API ENDPOINT for virious CRUD OPERATIONS
